comment.author: 31767778@N06
comment._content: Why did she sink? It's a calm sea, no rocks in sight, clear weather, presumably 400 miles offshore? Photo obviously taken from another ship nearby.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/monochrome_trains] Hi there, the Court of Inquiry in September 1930 reported that the sinking was caused by the breaking of the vessel's tail shaft (which was a spare). This led to a number of other problems, you can read all about it in the following newspaper report: bit.ly/PbhDsh. Hope that helps!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 31767778@N06
comment._content: Yes thanks very interesting. Must be a very unusual cause of a ship being lost
